pages.title: Frozen Atmosphere Shard
pages.text: In Phase 6, the atmosphere itself begins to freeze and deposit on the surface as thin, crystalline sheets of $(bold)Frozen Atmosphere$().$(br2)Mining these deposits yields $(bold)Frozen Atmosphere Shards$() — shimmering fragments of solidified air. Yes, you are holding the sky in your hands. No, ORSA does not recommend thinking about that.

pages.title: Sublimation Warning
pages.text: These shards are $(bold)extremely temperature-sensitive$(). If your body temperature rises above $(bold)-150°C$(), the shard begins to sublimate — reverting from solid back to gas.$(br2)You have approximately $(bold)7.5 seconds$() before it vanishes entirely. The shard will shimmer and emit snowflake particles as a warning. Then it's gone. Just like that. You are now holding slightly more air than before.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Wellness reminds you: don't cry over sublimated atmosphere.$()

pages.title: Preservation
pages.text: To safely transport shards, store them in a $(l:heating/thermal_container)Thermal Container$(/l). The insulated interior halts the sublimation timer entirely.$(br2)$(bold)Recommended procedure:$()$(br)$(li)Mine the shard$(li)Immediately open your Thermal Container$(li)Place the shard inside$(li)Do not panic$(li)If you panicked, see step 4$(br2)Shards stored in a container will remain stable indefinitely. Shards in your regular inventory will not.

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: Frozen Atmosphere Shards are a critical component in crafting the $(l:advanced/transponder)ORSA Transponder$(/l) — the device that may be your only way off this planet.$(br2)You only need one. But given the sublimation issue, ORSA recommends collecting several.$(br2)$(italic)"We designed a rescue beacon that requires a piece of frozen sky. In hindsight, we could have used copper wire. But here we are."$()$(br)$(italic)— Dr. Vasquez, Engineering Review Meeting$()
